Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and describe two different habitats, one on land (e.g., playground, garden, or forest) and one in water (e.g., pond or lake).
The student can observe and include in the drawings at least two different types of living things for each habitat, such as plants and animals (e.g., trees, grasses, lizards, fish).
The student can compare and show the diversity of life between the two habitats by highlighting differences in the types of living things present in each.
The student can use patterns to illustrate how different plants and animals are suited to their specific habitats, showing how these observations are connected to the diversity across habitats.
